subject: lexical set: my set for general American English
msgSnippet: We have been debating how to describe Quikscript in a more accurate way. If you have followed the discussion, several of us think using lexical sets is the
messageBody:
We have been debating how to describe Quikscript in a more accurate way.
If you have followed the discussion, several of us think using lexical
sets is the best way.

If you haven't followed the debate, the chart I have uploaded might seem
a bit confusing. But in the future, once we agree on how to use lexical
sets, the explanation will be very clear and easy to understand.

John and Anthony, here is a concrete chart that I think would work for
Americans. It is just a proposal, but I thought something concrete would
help the debate rather than something abstract.

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Pronunciation/set_am_dialect.pdf

Paul

  If you have followed the discussion, several of us think using lexical 
sets is the best way.

If you haven't followed the debate, the chart I have uploaded might seem 
a bit confusing. But in the future, once we agree on how to use lexical 
sets, the explanation will be very clear and easy to understand.

John and Anthony, here is a concrete chart that I think would work for 
Americans. It is just a proposal, but I thought something concrete would 
help the debate rather than something abstract.

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Pronunciation/set_am_dialect.pdf
